means: [人名] [英格兰人、苏格兰人姓氏] 达吉恩可能是职业名称，车工或刀匠，也指中世纪时做刀剑柄的木料

sentence.Network_en: This only heightened the dudgeon of the American Catholic right.
sentence.Network_cn: 这只会增加美国天主教右派的怨气.

怒字开头的词语_百度知道 ... 怒气[ anger;fury;indignation;wrath;rage] 怒气冲冲[ in a dudgeon].

entry.def: If you say that someone is in high dudgeon, you are emphasizing that they are very angry or unhappy about something.

example.ex: Washington businesses are in high dudgeon over the plan.
example.tran: 华盛顿的企业对这项计划非常不满。

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of intense indignation (now used only in the phrase `in high dudgeon')
